PostSnapshot() PostSnapshotPhoton.Pun.Simple.ConnectionTickOffsets Photon.Pun.Simple.ConnectionTickOffsetsPostSnapshot
void Photon.Pun.Simple.ConnectionTickOffsets.PostSnapshot ( )
This clear could be a bit more intentional Clears valid frames so that lookahead isn't find outdated frames for its buffer adjustments.
Definition at line 174 of file ConnectionTickOffsets.cs. Here is the call graph for this function:
SnapshotAdvance() SnapshotAdvancePhoton.Pun.Simple.ConnectionTickOffsets Photon.Pun.Simple.ConnectionTickOffsetsSnapshotAdvance
void Photon.Pun.Simple.ConnectionTickOffsets.SnapshotAdvance ( )
Checks the state of the buffer, and returns the number of snapshots to advance to keep the buffer happy.
TODO: May be able to reduce this in the future to a less aggressive look ahead
Buffer emptied - either means drop/sever connection hang, or way behind.
No valid frames, but we just received one late - buffer needs IMMEDIATE HARD correction
No frames have arrived late, looks like bad packetloss. Don't adjust the buffer in case it corrects.
Buffer is too small
Buffer is too large
Limit advance to only one extra snapshot to shrink the buffer, unless this is startup - then we need to burn all backlog.
Buffer is happy.
